newsitem.title: USA: HCIA stock crumbles after profit warning.
newsitem.headline: HCIA stock crumbles after profit warning.

text.p: The stock of HCIA Inc. crumbled in heavy trading Tuesday, a day after the health care information company said weak revenues would drag its earnings well below analysts' expectations.
The stock fell $28.25 to $31.75 on Nasdaq, where it was the most active issue in late morning trading.

Late Monday, Baltimore-based HCIA said it expected earnings per share of 10 cents to 15 cents, before a one-time $41.2 million charge, in the third quarter, and around 15 cents to 20 cents a share in the fourth quarter.
That was well below analysts' forecast of 29 cents a share for both quarters, according to First Call.

HCIA, which develops and supplies clinical and financial information systems for the health care industry, reported a loss of $327 million, or 4 cents a share, on revenues of $16.5 million in the second quarter ended June 30.

HCIA said it did not meet its third-quarter revenue goals, mainly due to a shortfall in its Commercial Markets group, which serves larger customers in the pharmaceutical, medical device and supply, employer, and consulting firm markets.
Analysts at Merrill Lynch and Alex. Brown downgraded the stock, although Alex. Brown later returned to a strong buy rating, citing HCIA's precipitous fall.
